intro: Corydalis mildbraedii, commonly known as the mildbraed's corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically range in color from pink to purple. The plant produces small, elongated leaves and has a creeping growth habit with stolons. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Corydalis mildbraedii is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats at high elevations.
